intro: Lecythis usitata var. paraensis, commonly known as the Amazonian Brazil nut tree, is a large tropical tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 50 cm in length. The tree produces heavy, woody fruits that contain up to 15–20 edible seeds, which are the Brazil nuts. It thrives in humid, nutrient-rich soils and requires a warm, stable climate. This species plays a crucial role in the ecosystem, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
